data.stimulus: You will earn a Digital Badge when you complete the IT Skills Diagnostic?

distractor_rationale_response_level:
✅ That's right! You lucky people!

Coventry University use Digital Badges to recognise achievement. Digital Badges are a great way to showcase and share your new skills with the world. Achieve a score of 75% or over (Level 3) in each of the topics in the IT Skills Assessment and you'll be able to collect and share your badge.

❌ You will!

Coventry University use Digital Badges to recognise achievement. Digital Badges are a great way to showcase and share your new skills with the world. Achieve a score of 75% or over (Level 3) in each of the topics in the IT Skills Assessment and you'll be able to collect and share your badge.

options.label: The value of your education and the way you learn.
You taking responsibility for your own development.

metadata.distractor_rationale:
All of these options are important factors in Academic Integrity.

The value of your education and the way you learn is probably the best description of what Academic Integrity means.

For further info, see the Get a head start page in this Induction space.

Though the Timetabling Web App is the correct answer here. You'll find timetabling info and a link to the Web App on each of these systems...

During enrolment there can be some delay in your timetable being updated. But don't panic - you'll find a Provisional Timetables in Aula (Course Community space > Journey > Materials > Information > Timetable)...

options.label: Do all the reading/preparation so you can have meaningful discussions and feedback in your classes
Submit your assessments on time, passing on your first attempt
Use all the support and resources available e.g. Academic Support Unit (Spotlight workshops)

data.stimulus:
What do we mean by "own your learning"?

See the Own your learning page of the Online Induction for more info.

Select all answers that you think apply...

metadata.distractor_rationale:
All these things!

Part of higher education is learning how to take control of your own learning journey. Don’t just assume you’ll succeed.

  • It is vital that you attend all your timetabled sessions...
  • In Aula, you'll find many resources and activities that you can access at any time...
  • Assignments can be stressful, but it is your responsibility to know exactly what is required and to submit your work on time...
  • And there is more than Aula and timetabled sessions available to you. Take a look at some of the support available from services like the Academic Support Unit -  and the Talent Team.

data.stimulus: Drag and drop the correct words into this paragraph explaining what Aula is...
data.template:
Aula is your {{response}}. It has a dedicated space for your:

  1. Online induction
  2. Course community
  3. A space for each module you will be studying.

Each space is divided into two sections: {{response}}and {{response}}.

Community is the where you can ask questions and share ideas {{response}}. Your Course Directors and Module Leaders may also use this area to post announcements and information.

The Journey section is divided into {{response}} and {{response}}.  

Materials contains resources and information about the {{response}} you'll need to complete. These could be an online activity, a quiz, sharing or discussing with your fellow new students, or something to {{response}} on your own.  

Assignments is available only in the desktop version of Aula and is where you can access  {{response}} for your assessments.

metadata.distractor_rationale:
Aula is your online learning environment. It has a dedicated space for your:

  1. Online induction
  2. Course community
  3. A space for each module you will be studying.

Each space is divided into two sections: Community and Journey.

Community is the where you can ask questions and share ideas with your peers. Your Course Directors and Module Leaders may also use this area to post announcements and information.

The Journey section is divided into Materials and Assignments.  

Materials contains resources and information about the tasks you'll need to complete. These could be an online activity, a quiz, sharing or discussing with your fellow new students, or something to prepare / complete on your own.  

Assignments is available only in the desktop version of Aula and is where you can access submission links for your assessments.

data.stimulus: In Aula, where do you go to switch to a different space?

metadata.distractor_rationale:
When you Sign In to Aula, you go straight into one of your current spaces (usually your Course Community space).

Selecting the space title at the top of the screen, should open a panel listing all other spaces which you are currently enrolled on.

data.stimulus: ...and where can you go to get Help & Support during your enrolment?

metadata.distractor_rationale:
If you are having problems with Aula itself, then you can contact Aula Support using the ❓ icon (if using the mobile app, select Profile > Help & Feedback).

There are many other places where you can get support, where you should go depends on the support that you need. For example, Aula Support won't be able to assist with specific questions about your module assessments. Here you might contact your Module Leader. You'll find their contact details on the Welcome page of each module space.

For an overview of all support services, head to the Student Portal: My Help & Support Services.

data.stimulus: ...and finally, where will you find the submission links for your assignments?

metadata.distractor_rationale:
That's it. Your Module space > Journey > Assignments

One thing though...you can't access this Assignments page using the Aula app. You must use the Desktop version, signing in at aula.education in your web browser.

data.stimulus: Which two assessments are you required to complete before you can collect your welcome goody bag from the Student Information Desk on the 3rd floor?

distractor_rationale_response_level:
Yes. The ALS (Academic Language & Skills) diagnostic exercise can be found here - libguides.coventry.ac.uk/ASU/ALS

Completing this assessment will ensure you are equipped to succeed on your course, as tailored feedback and learning support material will be provided upon completion...and will allow you to collect your welcome goody bag from the Student Information Desk on 3rd floor.

Yes. The IT skills diagnostic can be found here - es.eskill.com/es/quiz/?testId=a7f44fcda09f799b

Completing this assessment will ensure you are equipped to succeed on your course, as tailored feedback and learning support material will be provided upon completion...and will allow you to collect your welcome goody bag from the Student Information Desk on 3rd floor.
Not quite. Obviously quizzes like the one you're doing right now, are great fun and useful. But you don't need to complete them in order to get your goody bag.
Not quite. Obviously quizzes like the one you're doing right now, are great fun and useful. But you don't need to complete them in order to get your goody bag.

❌ You're early!

Teaching starts on Monday 24th January. There are other activities taking place before this week, like the School Induction event on Thursday 20th Jan, but teaching sessions will start on or after Monday 24th January. See your timetable for exact times of your teaching sessions.

✅ That's right!

There are other activities taking place before this week, like the School Induction event on Thursday 20th Jan, but teaching sessions will start on or after Monday 24th January. See your timetable for exact times of your teaching sessions.

❌ You're late!

Teaching starts on Monday 24th January. There are other activities taking place before this week, like the School Induction event on Thursday 20th Jan, but teaching sessions will start on or after Monday 24th January. See your timetable for exact times of your teaching sessions.

❌ You're very late!

Teaching starts on Monday 24th January. There are other activities taking place before this week, like the School Induction event on Thursday 20th Jan, but teaching sessions will start on or after Monday 24th January. See your timetable for exact times of your teaching sessions.
